intro: Selago monticola, commonly known as the mountain selago, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Selago monticola is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
